item.title: British Airways to bring back second meal for long-haul flights
item.description: 'We will upgrade catering so that everyone has better snacks and, on longer flights, everyone has a full second meal' — Alex Cruz, British Airways CEO
item.author: Simon Calder
item.dc:creator: Simon Calder
item.media:text: Flag carrier: British Airways Boeing 787 at Heathrow (Picture: British Airways)

item.title: New £20m Bear Grylls Adventure world lets visitors try their hand at extreme adventuring
item.description: The attraction will feature the highest free roam ropes in Europe
item.author: Helen Coffey
item.dc:creator: Helen Coffey
item.media:text: Bear Grylls heli-dropped into Cnicht in Snowdonia to announce the attraction (Picture: Bear Grylls Adventure)

item.title: The most welcoming cities in the world, from Singapore to Stockholm
item.description: A new list ranks cities by their openness to tourists
item.author: Helen Coffey
item.dc:creator: Helen Coffey

item.title: How Tel Aviv became the vegan capital of the world
item.description: With 400 vegan and vegetarian restaurants, Tel Aviv isn't joking when it calls itself the plant-based capital of the world, reports Jasmine Phull
item.author: Jasmine Phull
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Phull
item.media:text: Vegetarian Cafe Kaymak sources its ingredients from all around the world (Picture: Cafe Kaymak)

item.title: Italy holds first ever Tiramisu World Cup competition
item.description: The competition sought to find the best version of the famous dessert
item.author: Helen Coffey
item.dc:creator: Helen Coffey
item.media:text: A competitor puts on the last touches (Picture: AFP/Getty)

item.title: EasyJet reports nearly 10% jump in passengers during October
item.description: The London-listed company, which recently announced that it was paying around £35m for bankrupt Air Berlin's slots at the German capital's Tegel airport, transported just over 7.5 million passengers in October
item.author: Josie Cox
item.dc:creator: Josie Cox
